intro: Gouania exilis, commonly known as the slender gouania, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Gouania exilis produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are usually pollinated by insects.
